ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix on OS X
ygData.msgSnippet: ... No worries. ... The plist file looks like info the os needs to support double-clicking the application.  You ll be running Heritrix from the command-line.

Robert Mothershead wrote:
> Michael,
>
> Many thanks for your tips. I have a feeling I am doing something 
> fundamental
> and waffleheaded, but have little or no knowledge of just how and where my
> lapse is occurring.
No worries.
>
> But I did learn I earlier did not have a .MacOSX directory, nor an
> environmental.plist file within it. So created both and relogged in. Nada.
> My plist file looks like this; should I be using a different variable 
> other
> than /usr, perhaps my home directory name of /robertmothershead?
>
>
> <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
> <!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple Computer//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN"
> "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
> <plist version="1.0">
> <dict>
>         <key>JAVA_HOME</key>
>         <string>/usr</string>
> </dict>
> </plist>

The plist file looks like info the os needs to support double-clicking 
the application.  You'll be running Heritrix from the command-line.  You 
shouldn't need to edit this.

I just ran through the install scenario.  Looks like I don't even have 
to set JAVA_HOME.  It gets found.  Below are the commands I ran in 
terminal after downloading a new tar.gz bundle of Heritrix.  Of note, 
I'm using a bash shell -- not the default which is c-shell.  Thinking 
more on it, this is probably an important detail.  Set your shell 
preference in terminal preferences.

  502  wget 
http://crawltools.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/artifacts/HEAD-heritrix/20060601191129/heritrix-1.9.0-200606011911.tar.gz
  507  tar xfz heritrix-1.9.0-200606011911.tar.gz
  509  cd heritrix-1.9.0-200606011911
  513  chmod u+x bin/heritrix
  514  ./bin/heritrix


>
> Console messages: Does the NoInitialContextException message seems to
> suggest I've put something in the wrong directory or other issue?

What is this log below from?  Not finding an inittial context seems to 
indicate your CLASSPATH is a mess -- likely because the wrapper script 
didn't execute properly in the c-shell environment (A guess).

St.Ack
